meanings.definition: A person or business that offers goods at a reduced price.
meanings.sent1: The discounter down the street always has the cheapest prices on toys.
meanings.sent2: I like shopping at the discounter because I can save money on groceries.
meanings.sent3: The discounter decided to have a sale on umbrellas during a heatwave.
meanings.sent4: She was a discounter of smiles, always brightening people's days.
meanings.sent5: The discounter's store was a treasure trove of bargains waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: To offer goods at a reduced price.
meanings.sent1: I will discounter my old clothes at the garage sale next weekend.
meanings.sent2: The store decided to discounter their winter inventory to make room for new stock.
meanings.sent3: He tried to discounter his way into the hearts of bargain hunters.
meanings.sent4: The company had to discounter their products to compete with online retailers.
meanings.sent5: She would discounter her handmade jewelry at local markets to attract more customers.
